channel.title: CVE Feed for Fortinet -- Fortinet FortiClientLinux
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Fortinet -- Fortinet FortiClientLinux

item.title: CVE-2019-16155|2024-08-05T01:10:41.242Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20forticlientlinux
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability in FortiClient for Linux 6.2.1 and below may allow a user with low privilege to overwrite system files as root with arbitrary content through system backup file via specially crafted "BackupConfig" type IPC client requests to the fctsched process. Further more, FortiClient for Linux 6.2.2 and below allow low privilege user write the system backup file under root privilege through GUI thus can cause root system file overwrite.

item.title: CVE-2019-16152|2024-08-05T01:10:41.743Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20forticlientlinux
item.description: A Denial of service (DoS) vulnerability in FortiClient for Linux 6.2.1 and below may allow an user with low privilege to cause FortiClient processes running under root privilege crashes via sending specially crafted IPC client requests to the fctsched process due the nanomsg not been correctly validated.

item.title: CVE-2019-17652|2024-08-05T01:47:13.604Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20forticlientlinux
item.description: A stack buffer overflow vulnerability in FortiClient for Linux 6.2.1 and below may allow a user with low privilege to cause FortiClient processes running under root priviledge crashes via sending specially crafted "StartAvCustomScan" type IPC client requests to the fctsched process due the argv data not been well sanitized.

item.title: CVE-2019-15711|2024-08-05T00:56:22.368Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20forticlientlinux
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability in FortiClient for Linux 6.2.1 and below may allow an user with low privilege to run system commands under root privilege via injecting specially crafted "ExportLogs" type IPC client requests to the fctsched process.
